description: We're going to take a look at how the First Past The Post (FPTP) and Ranked Choice Voting (RCV) methods of voting work.
First past the post (FPTP) is the voting system used by most of the U.S. Every voter selects one candidate.
We'll represent votes as these colored dots.
We count the votes. Gracey Grey wins since she has the most votes, even though she didn't have a majority of votes.
Now let's take a look at how Ranked Choice Voting (RCV) works.
Ranked Choice Voting (RCV) is an alternative voting method used in Australia, as well in Maine and some Californian cities.
Every voter ranks each of the candidates.
We first tally all first-choice votes, as happens in FPTP. If one candidate has a majority, they win. But in other cases, like this one, we now use second-choice votes to determine the outcome.
Specifically, in RCV, we eliminate the candidate with the fewest votes after this round.
The voters who chose the now-eliminated candidate have their second-choice votes counted instead.
Rodrigo Red now wins with a majority of votes, even though Gracey Grey had more votes after the first round and won using FPTP.
